text: Doesn't work
It works on Google but unfortunately it doesn't work for YouTube (which ironically is also owned by Google)

This extension is awesome. Ignore the bad reviews, those people clearly didn't bother to look at the Extension Options page that SHOWS you how to exclude sites. Let me help you all out - let's say for instance that I wanted AP to exclude the BigDirtyButthole Forums: I would add the following lines to Site Options:

*bigdirtybutthole.net/*
/[^.]+\.bigdirtybutthole\.net\//

See? Nothing to it.

This plugin has a very serious bug in it. It sometimes sets all results on all Google pages to link to the first result. No matter what you click on, you go to the page of the first result of the first page.
Is it possible to have a hotkey to enable/disable this extension?

The extension works as stated, however I found a issue, if you set a filter to your search in google using "Search Tools" the extension will not have the filter on the pages it loads in. I would like to see a option to add support to websites that don't have it, ex:
"example.com/fourm/19238/1"
Then you enter in:
"example.com/fourm/*/<AP#>"
"<AP#>" Being AutoPagerize Number. Thankyou!
